text: Yes, you get Native Angeleno points for that observation.
author: KPCCsharon

text:
Today from 3-5p, I'll be asking you to contribute to KPCC. 
If you value the work I do to pull back the curtain on the hidden systems that make SoCal work (aka infrastructure) please donate. 
P.S. This is my dog Winnie eating peas.
http://www.kpcc.org/donate
author: KPCCsharon

text: It's a winner. I'm pitching on-air 3-5p today.
author: KPCCsharon

text: I like how you pre-populated the donation field with...
author: KPCCsharon

text: Or go cheer!
author: KPCCsharon

text: Uh boy -- Daylight Saving Time means the high speed peleton of riders is back at the Rose Bowl Tuesday and Thursday nights. And then this happened.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Super shocking indeed.
author: KPCCsharon

text:
How not to broadcast your live event on Facebook Live
1) Don't mic your speakers who are 18 feet away. People love room sound. So random!
2) Don't pre-test your connection. Let's just figure it out on the fly.
author: KPCCsharon

text: I made my jacket, btw!
author: KPCCsharon

text:
I sit next to the @LAist writers who think up these things. 
And it's exactly like you think it would be.
author: KPCCsharon

text: And here is the story.
author: KPCCsharon

text: 5/5 The study goes to three national labs and to state oil/gas regulators for review and recommendations on how to reduce the gas escape risk from the remaining wells at Aliso. I'll have a report up shortly. Meantime, here is @socalgas' take https://www3.socalgas.com/stay-safe/pipeline-and-storage-safety/aliso-canyon-storage-facility …
author: KPCCsharon

text: 4/5 Another peril is a big landslide. That could damage two or three wells enough to make them leak, but SoCal Gas says it will close or modify those wells. Shaking from earthquakes on other faults (not Santa Susana) not seen as damaging enough to cause leaks on the wells.
author: KPCCsharon

text: 3/5 The Santa Susana Fault runs under the gas storage field. Each of the 66 wells cuts through the fault. Study says they should be fine in a lesser earthquake, one lower than the high 6 magnitude.
author: KPCCsharon

text: 2/5 It's a summary of the draft independent report of the seismic risk to the 66 active gas wells that remain at the Aliso Canyon gas storage field. It says an earthquake in the high 6 magnitude or higher on the Santa Susana Fault could damage some wells enough that they leak.
author: KPCCsharon

text:
1/5 Ever since the 2015 gas well blowout at Aliso Canyon, Porter Ranch residents and others have worried what would happen to the remaining wells in a big earthquake. Today, @SoCalGas posted this.
https://www3.socalgas.com/sites/default/files/2019-03/Summary%20of%20the%20Draft%20Aliso%20Canyon%20Gas%20Storage%20Field%20Geologic%20Seismologic%20and%20Geomechanical%20Studies.pdf …
author: KPCCsharon

text: I just thought to myself, what's the totally obvious place that Tarentino would go to signal "old Hollywood restaurant." I've tried eating there, really I have. Not a fan.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Really? Cool!
author: KPCCsharon

text: Just a guess -- Musso & Frank?
author: KPCCsharon

text: But see, here's what we're missing. We think they are there for us, proxies for the public. If you re-arrange your thinking, that they are there doing their identity dance for each other, well, then it makes a lot of sense. Plus camera time.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Especially annoying at fire and police briefings. We cycle through every politician and department head there, carefully ordered by rank. If there were actual content or unique perspective provided, I wouldn't mind, but it's mostly just thankful bloviating about teamwork.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Thanks for the thread. It does seem that the Aliso disaster accelerated thinking and actions about moving away from fossil fuels as well as looking more critically at what proximity to oil/gas is doing to quality of life.
author: KPCCsharon

text: I totally hear you, and it's worth being alert to our language.
author: KPCCsharon

text: They say truth has a half-life, no matter how hard you try to bury it, it will always find its way to the surface.
author: KPCCsharon

text: So kind, thanks!
author: KPCCsharon

text: That is a super-excellent question. I am guessing a lot of people listen while on bus and trains if they have the data plan or on-board wi-fi to receive it. I stream it sometimes on the weekends on long bike rides using a Boombotix bluetooth speaker.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Thank you. I did ride my bike to the gym this morning in the dark, and then to work.
author: KPCCsharon

text: You may recall the HBO series Luck was canceled after some horse deaths during or associated with filming at the track, as well.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Hi Brooks. I too, subscribe to the LA Times. Indispensable.
author: KPCCsharon

text: I would be interested to see an overlay of income/ethnicity with the locations of the video surveillance cameras.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Wow. I've always been astonished at the UK police procedural shows on TV where they can look up any street any time. And now it's in CA. Geez.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Thank you to the legions of responders who feel that question feels more like a command performance.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Transparency matters.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Clearly not someone who grew up running a pizza parlor!
author: KPCCsharon

text: The parcel where a gasoline tanker trailer leaked fuel and exploded Sunday is listed on L.A. County property and tax records as a single family home, and it was nearly surrounded by homes. But it had been used for industrial purposes for what appear to be decades.
author: KPCCsharon

text: While we're talking about #DefensibleSpace,  SCE is trimming trees in some foothill areas, and neighbors who value their leafy shade are quite angry. How can residents find that balance between the trees they love and the fire safety they need?
author: KPCCsharon

text:
This map filed with the California Public Utilities Commission shows whether your home or business is in or near a high fire risk area.
https://ia.cpuc.ca.gov/firemap/
author: KPCCsharon

text:
This is one of those tough situations where residents' love for their shade trees runs up against @SCE's urgent need to clear tree branches from power lines. Residents are angry, and SCE has new laws on its side. 
https://laist.com/2019/03/18/socal_edison_tree_trimming_altadena.php …
author: KPCCsharon

text: The Inspector General's office at LAUSD that oversees a $9bb budget appears to be having its own internal chaos. Read @kystokes report:
author: KPCCsharon

text: Aaargh. As a native Angeleno, and outdoor endurance athlete, I'm not handling all this wet weather very well. At least we have Daylight Saving to make it somewhat less awful.
author: KPCCsharon

text: They should call that meal, "The Beast"
author: KPCCsharon

text: Quick, counteract all these bad numbers with a Powerball ticket.
author: KPCCsharon

text:
Call out to my energy and enviro peeps. How did the Aliso gas well blowout (shown here during the four months it was active) change how you think about energy in SoCal? 
Message me with your insights and we can chat.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Tell LAist and KPCC your parking gripes. Use the link to get it in front of a reporter.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Yeah. The cell phone waiting lot needs better signage.
author: KPCCsharon

text: Who's in Playa del Rey smelling gas?
author: KPCCsharon

text: So here's the thing people don't think about. If it were a city-owned power utility like they have in Burbank, Pasadena and Los Angeles, ratepayers would pay the cost of utility-caused fires because they are also the shareholders.
author: KPCCsharon

text:
Officials determined @SCE equipment caused the massive Thomas Fire, and a day later CEO Pedro Pizarro says CA law needs to change to let them pass damage costs to ratepayers if it is found to have managed the system prudently.
https://www.eenews.net/stories/1060127409 …
author: KPCCsharon

text: When I take people on sight-seeing runs of DTLA, we start at Union Station and eight miles later end with breakfast at Philippe. And I always get the cinnamon sugar donut and egg custard. Breakfast of champions!
author: KPCCsharon
